result.execSummary:
The defendant Kameron J Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **AMENDED 3/9/2016 to change the term of probation to 1 year.**

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Waive court costs. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Comply with treatment program from mental health assessment including taking medications as prescribed. Participate in the Fatherhood Program at the YMCA. Comply with family court order. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Counseling that is directed towards domestic violence. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

St- In 15CF1471 Plea to count 3; DRI count 1 & count 2. In 16CF24 plea to count 1 w/o repeater; DRI count 2 & count 3. In 16CF60 Dismiss outright. 
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 3; DRI count 1 & count 2 in 15CF1471 & count 1; DRI count 2 & count 3 in 16CF24. 16CF60 is dismissed outright.

14CF1363
Count 1- 4 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 2 Years es, i/s, 3 Years probation, to run consecutive to jail sentence, provide DNA sample + pay surcharge, waive court costs 

14CF1754
Count 1- 3 months RCJ, $100 domestic violence surcharge to be paid in 60 days, waive couts on count 3 & 4
Count 3- 4 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 2 Years es, i/s, 3 years probation, concurrent with 14CF1363
Count 4- 3 months RCJ, to run consecutive to count 1, credit for time served

15CF1471
Count 3- Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, waive court costs

16CF24
Count 1- Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, waive court costs

Conditions:

Comply with treatment program from mental health assessment - taking med's as prescribed 
No drugs, no alcohol
Participate in the Father Hood Program at YMCA
Maintain employment, school or combination of both
Comply with family court order
Counseling that is directed towards domestic violence
Do not drive unless valid license
Eligible for CIP & ERP
Report to RCJ on March 5th @ 8:30 am, Huber for work, treatment & child care

Defendant Kameron J Simpson in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Kameron J Simpson in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Requesting another status date. Also request in 16CF24 & 16CF60 the bond be reduced to a smaller amount of cash or a signature bond. 
St- Objects to any modification of the bond.
BTC: Bond modification granted.

16CF24- $5,000 co signature bond with his mother Karen Simpson, DOB 7-14-1969. Placed on house arrest with GPS montioring, exceptions are going to court, meetings with his attorney, medical appointments including going to Behavorial Health Clinic and the eye doctor. If defendant can provide proof of employment to ZCI he may work. Not to consume or posses any drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor. Must reside at 1133 Marquette Street Racine WI.  

16CF60- $500 signature bond. All other conditions to remain in place.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 01-28-2016 10:00 am
for sentencing, on behalf of Defendant.

It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances, test randomly before the next court hearing. Follow all Family Ct orders.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.

**12/10/2015 AMENDED: Must post an additional $500 by Monday December 14th @ 5pm.**

BTC: In 15CF1471 Must post an additional $500 cash bond by Monday December 14th @ 5pm and will stay the bench warrant until Monday December 14th @ 5pm.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Def- Client is not present today and request this matter be adjourned to later this week.

BTC: Bench warrant stayed until 12/10. Defendant to report to ZCI to test.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
